paper.title: Fourier Algorithm Revisited
paper.venue: Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Algebraic and Logic Programming
paper.abstract: Only comparatively recently, Fourier solvability algorithm for linear constraints has been shown to be of great theoretical interest in Linear Programming: the fundamental duality theorem and other major results are a direct consequence of it. We show here that Fourier algorithm plays a similar role in (linear) Symbolic Computation and Affine Geometry. From this algorithm we derive easily a number of interesting results, characterization of geometric objects and algorithms which form a basis for a practical system to reason about linear constraints.
